diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of perforated appendicitis was supported by the patient's clinical presentation of nausea, fevers, chills, anorexia, and malaise, along with imaging findings from the CT abdomen and pelvis, which showed significant inflammatory changes in the right lower quadrant, an inflamed and hyperenhancing appendiceal structure, and the presence of an appendicolith distal to the suspected ruptured appendiceal tip.
